page.title: 03STIFFKEY RIVER WELLS NORFOLK
page.content: The river poses an interesting question. Instead of a flood plain,leading to a marshland estury with the mouth pushed to the west by longshore drift,there is a narrow gorge in which lies the village of Stiffkey,within 2 kms of the sea. The contours in grid squares 9343 and 9442 indicate the normal shape of a river mouth in 1953 the sea inundated the marshes as far as GR 945 424.These facts seem to sugest that the river may once have flowed to the sea this way. Why was it deflected? Perhaps at the end of the Ice Age, ice blocked the area of the old mouth and the dammed up water found a spill way over the watershed to the east, carved a gorge and a new course for the river.
